trial_identification.studytitle: Prevention of Bone loss in HIV-infected patients taking Highly Active Antiretroviral Therapy with Zoledronate
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A two year double blind, randomised, controlled trial to evaluate the efficacy of zoledronic acid in the prevention of bone loss in patients infected with human immunodeficiency virus taking highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART)

interventions.interventions: 4mg intravenous zoledronate given annually for 2 years compared with placebo. All participants will also take 50,000u calciferol monthly and 400mg calcium daily.

primaryOutcome.outcome: The change in spine bone density over 2 years in the zoledronate-treated group compared to the change in the control group.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The change in hip bone density in the zoledronate-treated group compared to the change in the control group.
The change in bone turnover markers in the zoledronate-treated group compared to the change in the control group.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: HIV positive and have taken HAART for at least 3 months and have a bone mineral density T score of less than -0.5SD at any site.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Renal impairment (serum creatinine >0.15 mmol/L), untreated hypothyroidism or hyperthyroidism, chronic liver disease, concurrent major systemic illness, including malignancy, active major gastrointestinal disease, metabolic bone diseases, primary hyperparathyroidism, more than 2 hospital admissions within 6 months of study entry, use of oral glucocorticoid drugs equivalent to an average dose of prednisone 2.5 mg/day in the preceding six months.

trial_design.concealment: Medication was prepared by a nurse not involved with study participants. The medication was then administered by a study doctor who was unaware of the contents. All study personnel with patient contact were blinded.
trial_design.sequence: Computer-generated random numbers in variable blocks.

fundingsource.fundingname: Health Research Council of New Zealand

secondarysponsor.sponsorname: University of Auckland Bone Research Group

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This is a 2 year study designed to determine whether the use of an annual dose of zoledronate prevents bone loss associated with HIV infection
